They were very complementary and great with both meats. All the veggies were ideal for these broths as well - just be careful - the squash gets VERY hot in the broth! 

Interior design is simple and chic. You don't feel like you're in a marina restaurant anymore, but instead transformed to a cozy nook in Japan.
author: Allison L.

description: The hostess has no system for determining how long your wait might be. We arrived at 6:50pm and were told that the wait would be 45 minutes to an hour. When we came back at 7:45 and we were told a very confusing story about why we couldn't sit yet but still weren't given a clear answer about when we would be seated. We hung around by the entrance until 8:15 then tried asking again, and still had no clear idea of when we'd be seated. At that point it was very clear we should give up. I had eaten there once before and it was good, but not good enough to warrant the long wait and lack of organization. Won't be returning.
author: Maggie O.

description: We went here on a Sunday night around 7 and were seated right away. My girlfriend and I ordered a large shabu shabu with miso to share and got some extra pork belly to make sure we had enough food and it ended up being the perfect amount for two people. It was absolutely delicious, the waiters were all super nice and attentive, and at the end of the meal the make you rice pudding at the table out of the rest of the broth! They even brought us complementary ice cream for my girlfriend's birthday! This is one of our new favorite spots!
author: Madeline S.

description: Shabu shabu is on point here. It's in a nice place on lombard st and good modern ambiance. We went at a time where it wasn't busy but I liked the long tables and the service here. The meat itself is quite tender, and the soup seasoning is reasonable for the hotpot. The veggies pretty fresh as well.
author: Han S.

description: Omg, this is the best nabe/hotspot spot in San Francisco!   My boyfriend and I shared sukiyaki and kimchi nabe, both of which were amazing. It tasted pretty authentic and was filled with lots of vegetables and even mochi. The meat was very nice, we even got the Miyazaki gyu which was so soft and worth every penny. The best part is the rice porridge they make with the remaining broth at the end. It is delicious. There was no problem about wait times and the service was great. All round A* and I can't wait to come again next time.
author: Miu K.

description: Nabe is excellent, I started going once a week! I love the sukiyaki and the kimchi pots. Nabe's quality for their beer and pork is by far a cut above the rest. The Miyazaki A5 melts in your mouth. Love the standard Kobe too. I like to add extra mochi to anything I get. Start things off with the octopus salad and the pork gyoza. The beef one are good too but the pork ones are my go to!
author: Steve S.

description: YUM. Everything so good. The mochi was different but so good. Recommend the spicy kim chee and the dasio broth. The porridge at the end is the best part. Don't fill up so you get to eat this!!!
author: Taylor P.

description:
The atmosphere was awesome.  When I was looking for the actual restaurant, it took a bit to fine because the entrance was so nondescript.  The door was just a big black door, no signs or anything.  Made feel like one of those secret places that only selected people know.

The inside of the restaurant was very nice and modern.  The food was awesome.  We got the duck based soup and it was on point.  The beef and pork belly was incredible.  But the best part was when we were done with the food.  They used the soup base to make a porridge.  That was the best.  

There will be a next time and many more to come.
author: Charles L.

description: I went to this place about 2 hours ago and its really good. Me and my friends got 2 items, required to get more than 1 item when the party is 3 or more people. We tried both miso and spicy miso broth and I really like the spicy. The regular miso broth is too blend and does not have much flavor. We had both regular nabe with beef and a vegetarian one. Unfortunately vegetarian one cannot have a spicy miso since one ingredient in the broth is bonito flakes, which is fish. There was not as much meat as i wanted even when we got a large and ordering additional meat was a little too expensive in my opinion. But the overall experience was great. The porridge was so good! I did not expect it but it was a pleasant surprise. I tired their house mochi cakedessert with sesame ice cream and it was average.
author: Hayoung K.

description: Came when it was cold and called ahead because we were planning to go 15 minutes to close but the staff was more than welcoming and kind. Really enjoyed the rice porridge they make with the leftover broth at the end! We were just visiting the city and the staff was very friendly and even recommended some good bakeries and cafes to check out. Food itself was warming and good since it was chilly out at night, inside was small but nice ambience with the art curtain things (there's probably a name for them that I don't know). Would recommend!
author: Katherine S.

description: Wow!!!! Couldn't ask for more from a restuarant. Food awesome, service excellent, cleanliness 5 star,  atmosphere very nice.  Defintely will come back every week and I live in East Bay . Yes that good and well worth the commute even with traffic.
author: Simon T.

description: Came here after work with the hubz. Fast service, delicious food! Broth is definitely the best when all veggies are mixed in.  Will definitely come back!
author: Jessica Elaine S.

description: First time here and it did not disappoint. The Kamonanban (Duck Breast) Nabe is a must try. Shabu Shabu Wagyu Beef was heavenly. Zosui Rice Soup was a prefect finisher to end the meal.
author: Betty H.

description: Excellent Japanese hot pot. Best in SF in my opinion. I like getting the beef and Miso. Pork is good too. Try getting a raw egg and dip the beef in the sauce then egg - changed my world. They also serve this really good beer called Harajuku Girl from Holy Craft Brewing Company. It's brewed with Yuzu and has a nice citrus flavor that works with hot pot. Definitely recommend pairing. For dessert they have mochi pound cake with black sesame ice cream that disappears after about two minutes for some tasty reason.
author: Klaus S.

description:
Not recommended for large groups (bigger than 3-4).

The hot pot here is good. I highly recommend the duck breast. However, I wouldn't recommend coming here in large groups. I just got back from there with a group of 14, and service was very very subpar. Not only did we have to wait a long time for our entire order to be delivered (our waitress forgot that we had ordered the duck), but they informed us that they ran out of rice (...what? this is a hot pot restaurant) while making our congi at the end. Also, the menu states in small text at the bottom that we only get one pot of congi per group. We asked the waiter if the rule could be relaxed, since we were obviously a very large group, and had occupied 4 hot pot tabletops. She declined, and offered us to make another pot of congi with extra udon (we would be charged extra). We asked if we would get separate servings if we came in 4-5 smaller groups instead of one large group, and she said yes. This rule makes no sense, and unless it's changed, I don't think it makes sense to bring your large group of friends to Nabe.
author: Anarghya M.

description: I love nabe on Lombard street.  It is always fun, fresh, delicious and friendly.   I have been there ten times and had a superb service and delicious dinner on every visit.  It is also great for kids and those with a gluten free diet.
author: Danna A.

description: The ambience is very nice, modern, and clean. Looks like a new place. The vegetarian options are very limited - there's only a mushroom hot pot dish, and it's just okay, nothing special. I wish there was more of a variety. It's $21 for the regular size. All the dishes have regular and large options. The seating is a little awkward, however, because a table for six has only two placements for hot pots.
author: Nitesh D.

description:
this place is really hidden from the outside.  it's on lombard and has opaque windows and black on the outside, so it looks like a club.  i couldn't even find the door initially.  once inside, it was super steamy and warm from all the hotpots.

for 4 of us, we ordered half sukiyaki and half seafood.  we then added an additional platter of meat, enoki mushrooms, fishcake, and kimchi.  it was enuf food for 4 of us.  afterwards, they make congee w/ the leftover soup.  since our pot was divided into 2 broths, we asked them for 2 separate congees, and they said they had to charge us for an additional bowl of rice.  they will only do one bowl of rice for the entire pot otherwise, which is pretty lame if there are 4 people.  we ended up getting the extra bowl of rice anyway.
author: Helen T.

description: Had the Kim chi and sukiyaki and it was bomb! Beautiful decor and friendly attentive staff. My girls and I had a great time. Thank you!
author: Connie L.

description: I recently spent a month in Hong Kong, and never built up the urge to try hot pot. I didn't really understand how it worked, and while visiting SF my wife and I decided we just had to try it. The atmosphere and shared seating was a wonderful reminder of HK, and the food was amazing. It's a wonderful dinner setting to eat slow and enjoy great company.
author: Jennifer R.

description: Hot pot was delicious! I tried the kimchi and spicy miso! Vegetable selection was awesome and the portion of meat is perfect for a full stomach. The ending is the best part! They ask you which broth you would like for the porridge they make you! Soooo delicious! I've been to many hot pot places and this place is one of the top best for me!
author: Sandra P.

description: This is a good place to have shabu shabu other than Sichuan style. They do have option to go half and half, but I always just have sukiyaki that being the reason for the visit. The downside is that there portions are small and therefore, it will cost you more than little sheep. With drinks, it usually comes down to around 150 dollars for two.
author: J S.

description: Amazing contemporary, modern, minimalistic hot pot restaurant. Service was warm, friendly and efficient. When we came, it wasn't too busy so we always had someone attending to us. The vegetables and meat quality are fresh, crisp and of high quality. They have different soup selections and I highly recommend the sukiyaki + spicy miso. After you're done with the hot pot portion, the servers will prepare congee from the broth that is left in your shabu. Overall a great experience and I would definitely come back.
author: Carissa L.

description:
All I can say is that I cannot go back to Shabu House or just any regular Shabu after this! You can definitely taste the difference in quality in both their meat and broth. 

My friend and I ordered a split pot with wagyu beef with spicy Miso and half duck breast with Dashi broth. We also ordered the kurobuta sausage as appetizer.. and everything was just amazing. Their spicy Miso base actually had flavor! Now I've been to quite a few Shabu places and their Miso soup base is always a disappointment because either it's not spicy or there's no flavor. Not this place! It was spicy and actually tasted like Miso! 

Right when we were about to call for the bill our waitress told us that there was more food! Apparently they use your leftover broth and make a rice porridge with it. We chose to use the Dashi broth since we didn't want spicy porridge. It was sooo good! The porridge tasted kind of sweet and smoky. It's hard to explain but trust me, you'll get what I mean when you try it for yourself. We were literally holding our stomachs because we were so full... but let me tell you now that it is a MUST TRY! They also have quite an extensive menu of Sake and Japanese Beer. Big plus!! 

Surprisingly, even though it's located on a busy street we had no trouble finding parking at all. I'll be back!!
author: Catherine C.

description:
Not bad place to enjoy hot pot in a rainy day.
Clean hip and enjoyable environment. The pork actually is better than the beef.
author: Ai S.

description: This place is pretty new. I like how at the end, they cook you a free porridge from your leftover broth. So good! Something different
author: Natalia H.

description: I been eagerly waiting for this place to open for months! I've always loved their first location and wanted to see how this compares. It is just as delicious as the first! The decor in this place is amazing. It gives you the "Japanese street" feel. Like always, I start with the octopus salad which was very fresh and appetizing. Me and my BF always gets our own sets. I get the duck breast while he takes a spicy miso shabu. I LOVE the dashi broth! It's a soy base broth that's savory and so flavorful. The portions were perfect and they also give you a complimentary rice porridge at the end. Make sure you try it as this is one of the things Nabe is famous for! Also, they have Asahi draft beer here. So it doesn't come from the can. It taste so much more smooth and crisp. Love this new location.
author: Anna Z.

description: This place was incredible! The food from start to finish was delicious and all tasted very fresh. We tried the waygu beef and the kimchi pork sets and split it among 3 people, which was plenty. The garlic Edamame were also super flavorful and bonus points to the staff who were extremely knowledgeable and friendly. Definitely coming back here for another great experience.
author: Aaron E.

description: Enjoyed our dinner here tonight especially the rice porridge at the end. What a comforting and delicious meal!
author: Katrina C.

description: Best shabu shabu my wife and I have had so far! We've been to pretty much all the popular joints in SoCal and have to say, Nabe is so legit. The wagyu beef is sliced paper thin and is so flavorful,and the spicy miso broth was perfect. Not too thick, clean, and perfectly spicy. The wife loved her spicy miso broth and mushroom/vegetarian option. The house made ramen noodles were excellent. Even though we were happily stuffed, the rice porridge with fresh egg/green onion/seaweed the waiter made with the leftover broth was the cherry on top. The signage isn't very visible and the black door makes it sort of hard to find but with no wait on a Friday night, I would say that it was a plus.
author: Mikia K.

description: Amazing shabu shabu hot pot! Meat was fantastic, and loved all the side options. The broth was very flavorful, although the spicy broth was bit too spicy for my taste so I'll have to try the regular miso broth next time along with the duck. Loved the porridge at the end - such a unique thing that I've never had. Space is very beautiful and modern. Can't wait to come back!
author: Cathy B.

description: Nabe is my absolute favorite restaurant in the city. Best shabu shabu ever. Period. They really know what they are doing here. All ingredients are organic and the freshest. Been going here for years since they opened and going at least once a week since and stopped going to Shabu House completely. Miso shabu shabu and the sukiyaki are the go-to's. Eat the GOUMA sauce over rice!!! Hilwin and her staff do a top-notch job. You will have the best hot pot experience of your life!!!!!
author: Samantha S.

description: Great menu and no line. I think it might be due to lack of signage outside but I got the shabu shabu wagyu and Gyozo beef. I bet in like a few weeks all the hipsters will find this place and they'll be a line out the door
author: Mark A.

description: This is my fav shabu shabu in the city. They made their own sesame sauce, not BOTTLES like other chinese shabu shabu places. I don't feel that thirsty MSG feeling after. The quality is there and I like this location, because it's a bit bigger than Irving St. Service is always no complains. I'm addicted with their 'mochi cake'....oh gosh, so chewy, yet not too sweet. Japanese level sweet and with sesame ice cream, yum yum.............
author: Clemencia S.

description: This place was amazing.  Got the Wagyu Beef with Spicy Miso.  Was basically the Shabu version.  Shared with my date and it was more than enough.  Was stuffed after the porridge they make with the leftovers but it was amazing wanted to finish every bite.  Good location, and really awesome ambiance/decor.  Great service too.  Check it out!
author: Jay H.

description: Came to check out this place on a Saturday night and sadly was very disappointed since the photos of the food looked appetizing. The broth in the wagyu sukiyaki and duck were 6/10. Additionally it felt like they were quite frugal with portion size. This wasn't impressive at all for shabu in SF, and the service didn't make up for it. The waitresses were busy running around and it was difficult to catch their attention for anything if you were seated towards the walls versus in the aisle way.
author: Connie Y.

description: Best Shabu place hands down!! So happy they opened a new location!! Same amazing quality food as the sunset location! Service is 10/10! The restaurant is gorgeous!!
author: Andrew H.

description: This place is so good that I hope this place doesn't never gets hyped and overrun with people causing long hour waits. The broth here is on point. They're also very traditional
author: Nicole S.

description:
best hotpot in the bay!

have been itching for some hot pot and this is the spot to fill that itch. the interior is done very well. the food is spot on and delicious. and the kimchi, yummmmmy! and home made deserts!
author: michelle c.

description: Excellent dining experience. Just as good as the original but the dining room is much bigger. I'd definitely recommend folks from North and east bay to give this place a try. Well worth the trip across a bridge. The home made mochi cake is a must.
author: Matthew L.
